positive.review:
Although my playtime is about 16.3 hours as of writing this review, I would say it is likely closer to 14 hours as I left the computer on with the game running. That was enough time to complete one run (from being a toddler to an adult) while reading almost all dialogue and another run skipping almost all dialogue.

 In this game, you have the choice to:
- capture animals and horses
- train said horses
- race said horses
- show said horses in a beauty contest
- adventure through four different areas in a demon-riddled fores
- romance almost everyone and take them out on dates
- receive special gifts from characters with a high enough relationship score
- act in plays
- watch movies
- work at the bathhouse
- mingle with the elite in banquets
- draw sketches
- paint paintings
- study
- enact order as a vigilante in a dark alleyway
- fish
- go boating
- grow crops
- cook dishes
- read books
- manage a school schedule
- purchase weapons clothing, and a very small assortment of goods related to farming, horseback riding and showing, and alchemy
- decorate your room
- dress up
- chat and gift all characters items
- follow alongside your Hogwarts-style house via knighthood
- be either a good or bad father
- debate and/or fight almost everyone
- repent your inner darkness
- sell materials and cooked goods
- be tutored by the church
- attend and compete in festivals

There are some aspects, like performing developmental exercises as a toddler, that are locked to age. It feels like there is a decent enough progression to growing up and unlocking more things to do in the game. 

Dialogue was not like old Harvest Moon games or even Stardew Valley, where it becomes repetitive after a certain point when trying to raise your relationship with characters. I REALLY appreciated and commend Egg Hatcher for putting such varied dialogue. My first run through consistently felt new because of this despite repetitive activities I will dive into in a moment because I kept learning a little something about each character or the overarching subplots. However, I would be remiss to not point out the awkward translation from, what I'm guessing is Mandarin to English.

For example, when you take a character out on a date, there is an option at the end to, what I believe is, to essentially seal the deal with a romantic or flirtatious moment. I cannot remember what the actual word option was called, but it was not "flirt" or something similar. I only know this because I would often need to give the character something like a flower to unlock it, and then they blushed whenever I clicked it. I believe these translation issues likely dumbed down some nice writing for not only the dates, but the plot overall as well. I know this game has good writing because when you are acting in a play, you have to choose a text box option that fits the mood.

For example, the mood would be: Romantic.

The correct option would be something like:

If my love for you is the ocean, then you are the island I gently kiss with my waves.

Okay, okay, I know I'm not writing peak itself here, but y'all get the point. There were genuinely nice moments indicating nice writing despite the somewhat clunky translation. However, I still feel like the game is very easy to play and understand despite my gripes with the translation. Just don't give it to someone genuinely trying to learn English because it will seem strange. I wanted to go in-depth on this aspect just in case someone reading this intended to play it in English with English not being on a level of being able to put the puzzle pieces together.

The plot itself was definitely basic. There was a subplot involving feathers I feel was not explored enough. Either I somehow did not explore this aspect enough (as I did not play the evil route) or it was not delved into deeply enough for me. 

Actually, a lot of parts of the game felt rather surface level. For example, the fishing is just clicking fish in a pond and does not have an aspect with reeling in the fish like with Stardew Valley's bar or Animal Crossing's timing restrictions, and your companions may start as a nice add-on to adventuring but they quickly become just an extra body when you outpace them, even when you level them to your level. Most activities are basically waiting for a loading bar to complete alongside a cutesy animation. 

The companions part actually was so rough to work through as there was a part that, because of my level, was marked "easy" to complete while adventuring, but because of how the boss fight is conducted, you NEED other adventurers rather than just yourself. They just kept dying even though I was much more than just powerful enough to defeat it on my own, technically. You legitimately HAVE to get better weapons via Alchemy, which is already a pretty random process. (Despite me not having the slay 300 demons Steam achievement, I feel as though I can speak on this, as in my second run, I slayed 297.) It speaks to some balancing issues I have with the game, like how I feel as though the darkness values (you gain darkness when you do something morally wrong or dubious) should be more severe with consequences. It was too easy to simply "repent" almost all darkness away.

I also feel like it is important to say this is NOT a gooner game. You aren't weird with your daughter. The daughter is REALLY close with the dad even as a teen, which kinda made me weirded out, but that was more on me not having the greatest relationship with my own father, I think. 

The art style is cute. Clearly a lot of effort was put into it. It looks good on a 4K monitor. Music isn't annoying or bad. When you get to the end of the first run, you can see how many endings there are, and there seem to be a LOT more than what I was expecting. I literally never have found myself saying this, but if less endings meant some of the grinding within the game were more fleshed out mini-games or other parts, like more clothing to wear or more different types of fishes to catch, I would take it.

All of this being said, if you liked the choosing aspect of Telltale Games (but not the combat or having to be quick to choose), enjoy games where number goes up makes you happy (like Apotheon before it became incredibly problematic and completely changed), BitLife, or visual novels, I feel like this is the game for you. I did have a decent amount of issues with it, but I genuinely feel like if this game were released on Switch with the translation issues fixed after some advertising/being sent to some reviewers, it would be explosive in popularity. It is a little bit too chill for me, but that means everyone else who wants to potentially relax a little more than me would adore this game. I can see it being very easy to play on the Steam Deck. All aspects of the game, except for fishing, are easily playable with any controller. 

Genuinely, I am shocked this developer has not put out more on Steam at least. If Egg Hatcher genuinely kept making games like this, I could see them becoming one of the best for life sims ever. There are genuinely so many things to do. In this current world of some Indie games seeming incredible but extremely short especially for the price, this game will keep you occupied for hours. I tried to go quick on my second run, remember, and I still played 14 hours!!

Even if you are unsure, put this game on your Steam wishlist and buy it on sale. I'm likely going to email/go to X/attempt to join the Discord of the developer, as they are clearly not the largest, and offer to help with some rewording. I recommend everyone else also KINDLY point out some grammatical, spelling, or awkwardly worded sentences.

Raised my daughter and she bagged two baddies in her yuri route (those being Gwyneth and Mona).

10/10 game ngl.

A raise 'em up made with love. The translation can be a bit rough at times, but it's perfectly decipherable. The characters are nice to get to know. The raising gameplay choices properly itches my optimization brain. The game properly guides you to getting endings that you don't have with hints. Overall, I really enjoyed my time with Volcano Princess and if you like this type of game then you probably will too!
I have never played a game like this before, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I absolutely loved it. I was hooked from start to finish and can't wait to play it again after some time has passed.
Amazingly cute parenting-sim, I loved every minute of playtime! Looking forward to their next game!

Itâ€™s an amazingly fun game! There are enough different ways to play that replaying does not feel like youâ€™re just doing the same thing over and over again. If youâ€™re looking for a cute game to play for comfort and to enjoy your day, this is it.
I also think the visuals of this game are amazing.

this game is addictive and i love it. it's like princess maker. some of the translation is poor and im not sure what they are saying. also the rules for how to play the dice game is still really confusing and after all these hours playing this game i still don't know how to play the dice game. it goes by way to fast. i had to watch a youtube video to get the gist of it and still don't fully comprehend. theres still a lot of little things the game doesn't tell you and you have to figure out. but other then that i really love kid raising sims. ive been a huge fan of the princess maker series. so this was fun.

A fantastic take on the Princess Maker genre with solid and enjoyable gameplay, interesting characters, and cute art. The translation is a little off in many places including some minigame tutorials, but everything can be learned by doing. Now that I've completed my first run the next one offers New Game+ bonuses to help gather all the other many, many endings. I thinks that and the gallery for viewing the unlocks is very cool.
Great game, wonderful art, good story. As a dad of a daughter it got me in my feels.

The story of this game is enjoyable and, I like how it has multiple endings which adds replayability.

I'd recommend this game if you enjoyed Chinese Parents or other games in that niche.

Although there are minor formatting and language issues with the english version, i genuinely cannot recommend this game enough purely because of the amount of content you get. At first, I wasn't really attached to any of the characters, but while I was progressing through the story it's hard not to get attached to the characters, and there are so many options and ways you can spend your time raising your daughter.

This is one of my favorite games there is a lot of little details the developers put lots of love into. After a few playthroughs I still keep finding little details or plotlines I missed before. Can't wait for moon princess!

This game was so cute and fun. There was so much to do. If you enjoyed games like Stardew Valley you would probably enjoy this as it has the same â€˜grindy, repetitive, wholesomeâ€™ feel. It took about 10 hrs to get to an ending, but there are multiple possible endings depending on your choices and what you choose to grind: strength/stamina, intelligence/mind, and charisma. 

You play as both the fmc (daughter) and (her father) the mmc. You make decisions and actions as her father in early game, then are demoted to just decisions once the fmc gets to around 12 years old. Then the actions are conducted by the fmc, and the currency of actions is cheese or â€œaction pointsâ€.  There is also a mood bar which will decrease/increase with some activities. 

There isnâ€™t many voiced lines for the npcs/romance options, but all the interactions between the father and daughter are voiced (not for English).

It was an interesting game to say the least. You can customize your experience quite a bit based on what you want your daughter to do and become. It takes a second to get used to what is going on tho.
Fantastic game! I would absolutely love for you to become a judge who upholds justice and wisdom, my dear Ophelia.

Absolutely love this game. Artstyle is very easy on the eyes and story-writing is engaging. There are so many choices to make in the game and all of them have impacts. Can't wait to do more runs in the game to 100% it!

Just realised I never ever reviewed this game :0, I LOVE this game, it's really fun and cute, I always get so attached to my daughter and it's fun how there's so many different endings you can get, this game is super replayable as there are lots of characters to marry and lots of careers you can get (though you may want to follow a guide for a few of them) The game also has a true ending for you to find which is fun, this game is really cute and I really recommend it :3

The only negative thing I could say about this game is that the translation is rough at times. It never gets in the way of understanding the story, which is fantastic.

This game is a fantastic example of what the 'Princess Maker' genre has to offer. A must play for any visual novel and dating sim fans who like management and calendar mechanics.
Adorable game with a lot of different possibilities and a lot of charm. Highly recommend if you want a wholesome experience.

Cute game. Really liked how there's many different aspects of the game that you can dive into as well as the huge variety of endings (both career endings and romance endings) that can be obtained. Overarching story was surprisingly pretty good as well, which I was not expecting at all initially.

I am in agony....getting every achievement in this very, VERY, thorough game is almost as hard as convincing me to do my homework on time. I have WAAAAAYYYY too many hours on Volcano Princess, and a lot of it is me having to redo long runs because I couldn't get the hyper-specific career I needed for some reason. 

Gameplay? Amazing! There's so much to do and so much to see in VP. Gamble your life away in dice games, get your ass kicked by monsters because none of your hot waifus/husbandos want to go adventuring with you the first couple months, stat manage your daughter's skills and classes to hell and back! Embrace the life of a farmer, a horse-racer, a shady back alley explorer? Rest in the arms of the goddess to erase the darkness of your moody teen so she won't stop listening to her eye-less single father and become a cultist/prostitute/demon queen, and a whole plethora of other shady things. Debate people who are definitely smarter than you (damn you Claude!), duel people who are definitely stronger than you (damn you Lebsa!), go on dates with NPCs who are definitely too old to be going on dates with your poor unsuspecting daughter- er, what? (I'll get into that later). Embrace high society and attend parties where you have to have meaningless conversation with rich people, become an actress, work a job! A probably shady job! Become an alchemist, a painter, a- you know what I think you get it. There's a LOT to do.

The characters are all quite charming. It's fun to see how your bi-con daughter will grow up and what she'll take an interest in (we love women who also love women in this house!) and her love for her father is very sweet. The NPCs all have their own charm, the problem is a lot of the ones that shouldn't be romanceable are romanceable....like, wdym the Bard Derek has technically seen her around since she was 5 and he was a grown ass man who broke off an engagement with a fiancee he ran off with, but at the end of the game you can marry him??? This isn't even a one-off instance; the vast majority of NPCs that Rose can sweep of their digital feet are quite a bit older which isn't inherently a problem until you realize she's been around them since she was a minor....yikes. That's not even mentioning the NPC who WAS my total fav when I first started the game and was woefully ignorant to the plethora of concerning tags she'd have if she was in an AO3 fanfiction.

The plot itself is self contained and not bad...until you get into the "plot twist" stuff which makes no sense and also causes a looootttt of red flags should you choose to romance a certain NPC who honestly shouldn't be romanceable. But unless you're insane like me and want to do everything, you can play the game multiple times over without suffering from the knowledge I now have. 

WHY ARE THERE SO MANY JOBS OH MY GOD??? I love the abundance of choice, but I'm in AGONY trying to collect them all. I have like 7 achievements left. 

The art is very good, the CGs are also very nice. I love that one CG where Rose marries Kenneth it's very cute, also the harem end CG is fun. I like that Rose can be with one person regardless of their gender, TWO people regardless of their gender (polyamory in my sandwhich?), or half the main cast LOL. You go girl.

Great game, lots to do, lots to see, amazing art, overall quite unique as a game. I only bought it because I needed something to fill the "Long Live the Queen" shaped hole in my heart (still need more games like it!) but I don't regret the purchase at all.

The translation is a bit wonky, the achievements unlock incorrectly which makes it absolute agony to figure out what you still need to do, and there's so much concerning shit with the romances I'm half tempted to throw my Rose in a church and have her embrace the word of the Goddess over the love of mortal flesh...unless she seduces a priestess also significantly older than her. Cool. Why not? DON'T EVEN GET ME STARTED ON LEBSA. DON'T BE ME! DON'T BECOME A LEBSA FAN BECAUSE SHE'S HOT! GIVE UP ON THE WHIMS OF HOT WOMEN AND EMBRACE THE LIFE OF A MASOCHISTIC STAT BUILDING MANIAC INSTEAD!!!

....I'm going to go do my homework now.
It's so simple but so very very fun, I really enjoy raising our child in the game and how our choices impact her ending, there's so many variants I can't wait to reach them all!

This is one of the greatest games iâ€™ve ever played.

Volcano Princess is a phenomenal game. The world building and character building is actually insane. There are numerous diverse characters all coming from different backgrounds and having their own unique baggage that your daughter helps them grow from.

The game is also exceptionally well at representing how fast time goes by. Each month passes in the blink of an eye and before you know it, your daughter is already 18 and youâ€™re already at the coming of age ceremony. It is incredibly difficult, or almost downright impossible if you slip up just a bit, to max out all friendships. This emphasizes how crucial time management is because before we know it, those years and months could just slip by. It also perfectly encapsulates the rough transition for parents when their child goes through adolescence. Like your child just stops hanging out with you. Everyday you see a new unfamiliar face at your door asking to see your daughter. Her priorities have shifted and you can only just watch and offer advice when she asks for it.

The combat system and mini games are also very entertaining, ensuring that you always have something to do. There are also numerous goals and side quests to work towards depending on which friendship you wanna max out or which lord you swore your allegiance to.

There are so many branching endings and achievements to get, and this game is like stupidly cheap. 

Theres so much more i wanna express but i canâ€™t cause i just forgot or yeah whatever. iâ€™m not a parent nor am i an expert critiquer but holy this game is a masterpiece and i absolutely love it.

Uh main issue i got is romance system but who cares about that anyways u should totally place this game i love it ok thats it bye.

Barely scratched the surface of the game and will replay in the future.
Had a great and cozy time during my first run! 

ï½¡ â‚ŠÂ°à¼ºâ¤ï¸Žà¼»Â°â‚Š ï½¡

I thought I was just going to pla through this once, but I've already done two runs, am now contemplating a third, and possibly another one on top of that to try and save scum my way to allll the endings.


There's lots to do here. none of the systems are particularly complex, but the sheer variety is fantastic. You can fish, perform in plays, pain, fight monsters, romance a bunch of different characters, bake things, row a boat,  bathhouse cleaning, math puzzles and a whole bunch of slice of life hangout things, and...  They're all very simple minigames without a lot of depth but the variety will keep you busy juggling everything.

There's also a New Game+ that lets you carry a bunch of stats and relationships forward to make it easier to hunt for specific endings.

Daughter raising sim

@
Your daughter exhibit motherless behavior
yes??? just, yes? there's so much things to do, the plot is amazing, the art is beautiful. Not sure for some of these romantic pairings BUT OMG WLW???? so peak.
You can be a juragan pupuk and made 1 million gold in less than a day in this game.
Just remembered this 10/10 game, just coming back to give it that score.
Stat-raising VN with plenty of routes to find and get through.
I love this game sm, I will get all the achievements someday
Nice game! Can't wait for their next work!
absolute cinema !! my girl got the 'all the ladies ending'
became addicted the moment i opened it
MY SHAYLAAAAAA I LOVE THIS GAME SO MUCH I LOVE MY DAUGHTER

[b]backlog journal (2/150): playing & reviewing all my neglected sale games[/b]
[i]bought in jul 2023 â€¢ completed in nov 2025 (100%)[/i]

volcano princess is a parenting sim, where you play as a father raising your daughter in a fantasy medieval kingdom. you handle her daily schedule, education and hobbies. over time, she also grows through social interactions with various side characters. there are visual novel elements sprinkled in, including romance routes (you can pursue men, women, or even multiple partners). do note: some of the romanceable characters are noticeably older than the protagonist, which may be uncomfortable for some players. itâ€™s something to be aware of before diving into certain routes. ultimately, all your choices affect her career outcome, romance ending and even your â€œfather rating". with 25 romance endings and over 50 career endings, thereâ€™s a huge amount of variety!

i love the art style. everything is gorgeous, especially the cgs and the costumes. the relationship events are adorable, and the characters are surprisingly fleshed out for a game that isnâ€™t mainly a dating sim. the game also has a lot more depth than i expected. you can catch and race horses, debate and duel others, work part-time at the bathhouse, paint, perform in plays, fight in dark alleys, farm, cook & lots more! the character dialogues are an unexpected charm too. the characters say different things depending on the time, season or story events (like the coming of age ceremony), and taking them out on dates to the four different venues is always cute. some scenes even had me blushing >//< also, shoutout to ze and kennethâ€¦ iâ€™m obsessed.

thereâ€™s definitely replay value, especially if you want to 100% all the endings. the new game+ system gives you points based on achievements obtained, which you can use to boost your daughterâ€™s stats and speed up future runs. that said, getting every ending still felt a bit grindy and towards the end it did become a bit of a slog. it took me about 10 hours for the first run and around 44 hours total to complete everything. i also wish you could save anywhere instead of only at the end of each month.

the translation is mostly okay, but some parts could be improved. a few minigame instructions confused me, i had to look up a video just to understand dice duel. however, the main story itself felt a little confusing to follow & emotionally it didnâ€™t land for me. i was much more invested in the side characters and their interactions (their letters were so cute) than the core plot. some of the achievements are also not synced properly (e.g. you unlock achievement a in game but it unlocks achievement b on steam - you have to track your progress using the game's internal achievement instead).

overall, itâ€™s a beautiful, charming and surprisingly deep parenting sim with tons to do and lots of heart. despite a few rough edges, i loved my time with it.

[code]check out what i played next at [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/45862522]kitten's backlog journal[/url] â™¡[/code]

Although my playtime is about 16.3 hours as of writing this review, I would say it is likely closer to 14 hours as I left the computer on with the game running. That was enough time to complete one run (from being a toddler to an adult) while reading almost all dialogue and another run skipping almost all dialogue.

 In this game, you have the choice to:
- capture animals and horses
- train said horses
- race said horses
- show said horses in a beauty contest
- adventure through four different areas in a demon-riddled fores
- romance almost everyone and take them out on dates
- receive special gifts from characters with a high enough relationship score
- act in plays
- watch movies
- work at the bathhouse
- mingle with the elite in banquets
- draw sketches
- paint paintings
- study
- enact order as a vigilante in a dark alleyway
- fish
- go boating
- grow crops
- cook dishes
- read books
- manage a school schedule
- purchase weapons clothing, and a very small assortment of goods related to farming, horseback riding and showing, and alchemy
- decorate your room
- dress up
- chat and gift all characters items
- follow alongside your Hogwarts-style house via knighthood
- be either a good or bad father
- debate and/or fight almost everyone
- repent your inner darkness
- sell materials and cooked goods
- be tutored by the church
- attend and compete in festivals

There are some aspects, like performing developmental exercises as a toddler, that are locked to age. It feels like there is a decent enough progression to growing up and unlocking more things to do in the game. 

Dialogue was not like old Harvest Moon games or even Stardew Valley, where it becomes repetitive after a certain point when trying to raise your relationship with characters. I REALLY appreciated and commend Egg Hatcher for putting such varied dialogue. My first run through consistently felt new because of this despite repetitive activities I will dive into in a moment because I kept learning a little something about each character or the overarching subplots. However, I would be remiss to not point out the awkward translation from, what I'm guessing is Mandarin to English.

For example, when you take a character out on a date, there is an option at the end to, what I believe is, to essentially seal the deal with a romantic or flirtatious moment. I cannot remember what the actual word option was called, but it was not "flirt" or something similar. I only know this because I would often need to give the character something like a flower to unlock it, and then they blushed whenever I clicked it. I believe these translation issues likely dumbed down some nice writing for not only the dates, but the plot overall as well. I know this game has good writing because when you are acting in a play, you have to choose a text box option that fits the mood.

For example, the mood would be: Romantic.

The correct option would be something like:

If my love for you is the ocean, then you are the island I gently kiss with my waves.

Okay, okay, I know I'm not writing peak itself here, but y'all get the point. There were genuinely nice moments indicating nice writing despite the somewhat clunky translation. However, I still feel like the game is very easy to play and understand despite my gripes with the translation. Just don't give it to someone genuinely trying to learn English because it will seem strange. I wanted to go in-depth on this aspect just in case someone reading this intended to play it in English with English not being on a level of being able to put the puzzle pieces together.

The plot itself was definitely basic. There was a subplot involving feathers I feel was not explored enough. Either I somehow did not explore this aspect enough (as I did not play the evil route) or it was not delved into deeply enough for me. 

Actually, a lot of parts of the game felt rather surface level. For example, the fishing is just clicking fish in a pond and does not have an aspect with reeling in the fish like with Stardew Valley's bar or Animal Crossing's timing restrictions, and your companions may start as a nice add-on to adventuring but they quickly become just an extra body when you outpace them, even when you level them to your level. Most activities are basically waiting for a loading bar to complete alongside a cutesy animation. 

The companions part actually was so rough to work through as there was a part that, because of my level, was marked "easy" to complete while adventuring, but because of how the boss fight is conducted, you NEED other adventurers rather than just yourself. They just kept dying even though I was much more than just powerful enough to defeat it on my own, technically. You legitimately HAVE to get better weapons via Alchemy, which is already a pretty random process. (Despite me not having the slay 300 demons Steam achievement, I feel as though I can speak on this, as in my second run, I slayed 297.) It speaks to some balancing issues I have with the game, like how I feel as though the darkness values (you gain darkness when you do something morally wrong or dubious) should be more severe with consequences. It was too easy to simply "repent" almost all darkness away.

I also feel like it is important to say this is NOT a gooner game. You aren't weird with your daughter. The daughter is REALLY close with the dad even as a teen, which kinda made me weirded out, but that was more on me not having the greatest relationship with my own father, I think. 

The art style is cute. Clearly a lot of effort was put into it. It looks good on a 4K monitor. Music isn't annoying or bad. When you get to the end of the first run, you can see how many endings there are, and there seem to be a LOT more than what I was expecting. I literally never have found myself saying this, but if less endings meant some of the grinding within the game were more fleshed out mini-games or other parts, like more clothing to wear or more different types of fishes to catch, I would take it.

All of this being said, if you liked the choosing aspect of Telltale Games (but not the combat or having to be quick to choose), enjoy games where number goes up makes you happy (like Apotheon before it became incredibly problematic and completely changed), BitLife, or visual novels, I feel like this is the game for you. I did have a decent amount of issues with it, but I genuinely feel like if this game were released on Switch with the translation issues fixed after some advertising/being sent to some reviewers, it would be explosive in popularity. It is a little bit too chill for me, but that means everyone else who wants to potentially relax a little more than me would adore this game. I can see it being very easy to play on the Steam Deck. All aspects of the game, except for fishing, are easily playable with any controller. 

Genuinely, I am shocked this developer has not put out more on Steam at least. If Egg Hatcher genuinely kept making games like this, I could see them becoming one of the best for life sims ever. There are genuinely so many things to do. In this current world of some Indie games seeming incredible but extremely short especially for the price, this game will keep you occupied for hours. I tried to go quick on my second run, remember, and I still played 14 hours!!

Even if you are unsure, put this game on your Steam wishlist and buy it on sale. I'm likely going to email/go to X/attempt to join the Discord of the developer, as they are clearly not the largest, and offer to help with some rewording. I recommend everyone else also KINDLY point out some grammatical, spelling, or awkwardly worded sentences.

Visual novel and life-sim manageement. I like how you can decide if you want to be career-orientated and/or also have relationships. I was quite surprise it allows GL and NL, and even features multiple pairings ending at once(!) (=reverse harem ending), which I found quite rare? I also agree with the reviewer who said they aren't achievement hunter but this game makes them addicted to unlocking as many achievements as possible ðŸ˜­

Raised my daughter and she bagged two baddies in her yuri route (those being Gwyneth and Mona).

10/10 game ngl.

Have you ever wanted to be a girldad? Well, this game turns you into a single father working multiple jobs to support your little girl through her journey to adulthood. 

It's a great slow-burn game with incredible visuals, fun mini-games and heart-warming storytelling. There are so many characters to learn about, each with their own unique struggles and dreams. There are also lots of hidden details and endings to unlock! I definitely recommend this game if you're looking for a casual sims-esque visual novel with extra flair!!

iâ€™ve only completed the game once but thereâ€™s so many achievements &. different endings n paths for your daughter to take you canâ€™t help but wanna play over n over again. 

i loved being a girldad
This game is so cute I adore it, the gameplay is really fun, exactly what I was looking for coming from the princess maker series

For all its flaws in the english translation, it's still readable and honestly one of the better VN RPGs, the Life sim aspect is pretty good and the game's story and characters are very lovable. Honestly you can just stop after just one ending but going through a lot of the routes is worth it

This game is the best time sink ever. My only complaint? I have EVERY ACHIEVEMENT except for one (that's 233/234)---and the final one is a completely random event that you have to somehow find 3 times in one playthrough. HHHHHH ok but the game itself is a really simple and fun life sim, would recommend

I'm not really an achievement hunter, and probably will never complete every achievement here, but for some reason this game just drives up my desire to achieve every possible ending. the first play through was slow, but the subsequent play-throughs become easier as you know what you're doing, which makes getting the achievements easier too, but I just love the great feeling I get when I raise Rose into adulthood! It's really great! This game has been consuming my life for the past few days and I love it lol ^_^

A raise 'em up made with love. The translation can be a bit rough at times, but it's perfectly decipherable. The characters are nice to get to know. The raising gameplay choices properly itches my optimization brain. The game properly guides you to getting endings that you don't have with hints. Overall, I really enjoyed my time with Volcano Princess and if you like this type of game then you probably will too!

Brilliant game I was very hesitant to get at first.  The genre is not my cup of tea at all but reading all the reviews ended up convincing me.  As long as you head into this knowing that it's a life simulator, and there's a bit of grinding, you won't end up with any nasty surprises.  I ended up completing three playthroughs and found each story just as wonderful as the last.  Big yes from me on the recommendation!
I have never played a game like this before, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I absolutely loved it. I was hooked from start to finish and can't wait to play it again after some time has passed.

Super duper cute!!! The translation is a little bit rough, but like, it's understandable and very adorable. I think the best part is that there's so many achievements (it looks intimidating but I got over 70 in my first playthrough, so that's decent progress for this!), because there's so many different endings and like, customization going on. I can't wait to keep playing! I think the romances are also pretty nice/funny, and the fact there's poly endings is also a big plus in my books. It does feel like you (as her father) aren't really involved in her life for a bigger part when the game really picks up. So that might be something to think about, given it's not just a raising your daughter simulator, but rather a "you play as the daughter from a 3rd person pov" simulator, if I can put it like that. Despite this, I think the artwork is lovely, the music is fun, the combinations are endless... so truly, buy it if you can/want.
Amazingly cute parenting-sim, I loved every minute of playtime! Looking forward to their next game!

This game is truly stunning. The artwork, the music, the characters they all mean so much to me but the most important thing is that you are there and raising your child. Youre helping her go through life and help and support her. Watching her grow is truly something beautiful. Like in life itself once you have children you are not the main character, they are. You are passing the torch over to her and it's so heartwarming to me personally. Ive played a lot of different endings already, take some breaks from the game but always come back to this warm familiarity. It's truly fascinating how a game can capture so many emotions at once. Id recommend everyone to check it out, bc it's just so beautiful and I'm glad I checked it out.

this game is addictive and i love it. it's like princess maker. some of the translation is poor and im not sure what they are saying. also the rules for how to play the dice game is still really confusing and after all these hours playing this game i still don't know how to play the dice game. it goes by way to fast. i had to watch a youtube video to get the gist of it and still don't fully comprehend. theres still a lot of little things the game doesn't tell you and you have to figure out. but other then that i really love kid raising sims. ive been a huge fan of the princess maker series. so this was fun.

Beautiful art style. Got quite attached to many of the characters, especially my daughter who I wanted to be sure I got very close to and give her a great future. Loving the sheer amount of variety in endings she could go in. There were some parts in the writing that did feel a bit off to me, possibly due to how it was translated, but that did not completely come in the way of my enjoyment. Overall a wonderful game. Will continue to play this for a while longer.

Itâ€™s an amazingly fun game! There are enough different ways to play that replaying does not feel like youâ€™re just doing the same thing over and over again. If youâ€™re looking for a cute game to play for comfort and to enjoy your day, this is it.
I also think the visuals of this game are amazing.

This game was so cute and fun. There was so much to do. If you enjoyed games like Stardew Valley you would probably enjoy this as it has the same â€˜grindy, repetitive, wholesomeâ€™ feel. It took about 10 hrs to get to an ending, but there are multiple possible endings depending on your choices and what you choose to grind: strength/stamina, intelligence/mind, and charisma. 

You play as both the fmc (daughter) and (her father) the mmc. You make decisions and actions as her father in early game, then are demoted to just decisions once the fmc gets to around 12 years old. Then the actions are conducted by the fmc, and the currency of actions is cheese or â€œaction pointsâ€.  There is also a mood bar which will decrease/increase with some activities. 

There isnâ€™t many voiced lines for the npcs/romance options, but all the interactions between the father and daughter are voiced (not for English).

It was an interesting game to say the least. You can customize your experience quite a bit based on what you want your daughter to do and become. It takes a second to get used to what is going on tho.

Absolutely love this game. Artstyle is very easy on the eyes and story-writing is engaging. There are so many choices to make in the game and all of them have impacts. Can't wait to do more runs in the game to 100% it!

Just realised I never ever reviewed this game :0, I LOVE this game, it's really fun and cute, I always get so attached to my daughter and it's fun how there's so many different endings you can get, this game is super replayable as there are lots of characters to marry and lots of careers you can get (though you may want to follow a guide for a few of them) The game also has a true ending for you to find which is fun, this game is really cute and I really recommend it :3

The only negative thing I could say about this game is that the translation is rough at times. It never gets in the way of understanding the story, which is fantastic.

This game is a fantastic example of what the 'Princess Maker' genre has to offer. A must play for any visual novel and dating sim fans who like management and calendar mechanics.
Adorable game with a lot of different possibilities and a lot of charm. Highly recommend if you want a wholesome experience.

Cute game. Really liked how there's many different aspects of the game that you can dive into as well as the huge variety of endings (both career endings and romance endings) that can be obtained. Overarching story was surprisingly pretty good as well, which I was not expecting at all initially.

This is my first time review on the Steam and I all have to say is this game is a 1000/10 for me. Good Storyline, choice really matter and a lot ending route so we can replay all over again. Hope to find a lot of game that can be good like this. Waiting for your next game dev :)
Some of the English translation is scuffed but overall I really enjoyed playing this game. It feels like you can personalize it a lot.

This is hands down the best simulator game I've ever played. I've been playing this game for months on and off and everytime I start a new playthrough I discover some neet new gameplay mechanic or storyline. 

There are so many stats, all of which have a different minigame and managment system attached to them, which means that there always is something for you to do and the game loop is varied enough that you can sink 10s of hours into this game before getting bored of it. 

It's also a breath of fresh air when it comes to dating sims, since the game allows you to date both the male and the female characters, it also allows for polyamory endings which was a big and fun surprise. 

The only issue with this game is the english translation which varies in quality, however it never impeded my enjoyment of the game nor are the issues severe enough to where it's difficult to follow what's happening. 

Overall, 10/10
The new PM game I have been waiting for so long ! 20h in 6 days, great history, new mechanics and ideas. Hope to see the next game soon ! Highly recommended !
Less activities and jobs than Princess Maker but a distinct ambience and story. I like it.

A visual novel game about parenting and raising a daughter as a single dad in a fictional fantasy medieval European setting. It is part social sim and part management with turn based combat. Great game overall for people who enjoy such types of games.

Charming and wholesome life sim, very relaxing and simple point and click gameplay.
Makes you want to become a parent for a short while after you finish, would recommend to anyone who liked princess maker or life sims. Features multiple endings and lots of options for love interests, normal run may take up to 12 hours depending on how much effort you put into it.
Super adorable little game with SO MANY endings. So many people to romance (in a cute way, not NSFW). I really enjoy the stats leveling and attributes points. 8/10!!
Good game, Good story recommand for everyone have a few of a replayable value

if you like the princess maker games I think you will really love this one. except nobody really knows about those games however this is basically a modern day princess maker.. translation a lil wonky sometimes but it's more comedic than anything unreadable

decent game, took me like 12 hours to finish first run. was very enjoyable, though i'm too lazy to go through game again to get other routes :D
definitely buy and support dev
Fun game. Needs a better tutorial and has translation errors. Worth $10 factoring everything in.

I love how close the father is with the daughter, truly changes how daughter raising game's relationship with the father is like. The beginning of game, we shown as father holding daughter's hand and walk around the town, it strengthen the theme of the game! Its really make my heart melt.
It took long for me to understand the dice game, by end of my first playthrough- I FINALLY understood how to play and now I want second run where I play a lot of dice. The school system is also a bit confusing, how do I get more class? I think I got confused with the translation a bit. I could understand the dialouge, but when it comes to the tutorial, the translation gives me so many miscommunication (I still don't understand what 'Ambiguous' suppose to mean during dating scene'). I would blame my English too for that. 

But overall very cute game very adorable art! A lot of CGs, and I would call the combat pretty simple too! would recommend for lover of raising game who would like more exploration to the world if you don't mind with a little translation issue.

hands down just a wonderful game. nothing quite captures that visceral â€˜oh my god thats my DAUGHTERâ€™ feeling like volcano princess does. 

thereâ€™s tons of replayability within the career paths and romance options, as well as a beefy amount of achivements to collect. it gets addicting very quickly, and i have no regrets.

also, i personally think the eng translation is easy to understand, past some wonky moments where mini-games get explainedâ€” definitely not something to avoid the game entirely because of.
I rarely play any games like Volcano Princess, but i did, and even try to get all the ending for it.

I really like this game, It's got tons of endings and items to collect and the characters are really fleshed out. 100% would recommend to players who like visual novel games with replay value and good character development.
Really cute game, it does get repetitive but it's fun playing different routes to get different endings as there are quite alot of variations.
Didn't expect the story to be this good. Interactive cozy game with multiple ending
Cute fun cozy game, feels similar to Princess Maker. You have lots of choices to explore, take a journey down memory lane with your daughter, and create memories that last a lifetime.
It really is as good as Princess Maker 2, I highly recommend it.
The style of the game is very cute and adorable, but I haven't figured out how to play it yet.

negative.review:
The English translation of this game is quite poor. Sentences come out wonky and the text processor often splits lines mid word, or forces the ends of sentences offscreen. There's also no English dub (understandable), which means that missing text is lost forever.

I don't think this will be a dealbreaker for everyone, but it is for me.
LTG`s fav game

I really like Raising games such as Princess Maker. I tried to play through this when I was hungry for a similar game, and I KNOW that I should like this. It has all the makings for things I like in games like this. But GOD is the english translation terrible and totally Machine Translated. 

I can sometimes look the other way, but seeing as these games involve a lot of reading I quickly tuned out from playing this. If you can deal with MTL translations, then It's totally worth playing! It seemed to have quite a lot to do from what I played with many endings to pursue. I just cannot keep playing. It grates on me and drives me crazy and sometimes I just straight up do not know what I'm doing because of the TL and I really can't recommend it until it gets an update where they clean up the botched script.

This game seems really fun and might be something I was interested in, but the English translation was really bad. Lots of poor grammar or phrases that seem nonsensical, and are clearly the work of machine translation. I think the game would 100% benefit from an English speaker going through and cleaning up the script. 

Until that happens, I'm not really able to recommend this. I could look past this in most games but not in one as text heavy as this one.

Honestly, itâ€™s a really well-made time sink with a beautiful and very cute art style. Itâ€™s just that for a game that positions itself as a parenting sim, your baby daughter grows up in the first 2 hours, becomes the protagonist, and it turns into a mediocre and boring dating simulator. Itâ€™s a well-made game, itâ€™s just really not what I was looking for.

The English translation of this game is quite poor. Sentences come out wonky and the text processor often splits lines mid word, or forces the ends of sentences offscreen. There's also no English dub (understandable), which means that missing text is lost forever.

I don't think this will be a dealbreaker for everyone, but it is for me.

Extremely bland and uninteresting. Every chapter is a chore with point-click-point and no substance. Characters are one-dimensional with non-existing charisma. I couldn't care less about "a lot of endings" when each one of them is mediocre.
I don't know why this game gets reviews of "Overwhelmingly Positive".Although this game looks fascinating,for me it's just a copy-paste of Chinese Parents.essentially they are the same games.

Itâ€™s a well-made game, itâ€™s just really not what I was looking for.

The English translation of this game is quite poor. Sentences come out wonky and the text processor often splits lines mid word, or forces the ends of sentences offscreen. There's also no English dub (understandable), which means that missing text is lost forever.

I don't think this will be a dealbreaker for everyone, but it is for me.

Extremely bland and uninteresting. Every chapter is a chore with point-click-point and no substance. Characters are one-dimensional with non-existing charisma. I couldn't care less about "a lot of endings" when each one of them is mediocre.
I don't know why this game gets reviews of "Overwhelmingly Positive".Although this game looks fascinating,for me it's just a copy-paste of Chinese Parents.essentially they are the same games.
LTG`s fav game

I really like Raising games such as Princess Maker. I tried to play through this when I was hungry for a similar game, and I KNOW that I should like this. It has all the makings for things I like in games like this. But GOD is the english translation terrible and totally Machine Translated. 

I can sometimes look the other way, but seeing as these games involve a lot of reading I quickly tuned out from playing this. If you can deal with MTL translations, then It's totally worth playing! It seemed to have quite a lot to do from what I played with many endings to pursue. I just cannot keep playing. It grates on me and drives me crazy and sometimes I just straight up do not know what I'm doing because of the TL and I really can't recommend it until it gets an update where they clean up the botched script.

This game seems really fun and might be something I was interested in, but the English translation was really bad. Lots of poor grammar or phrases that seem nonsensical, and are clearly the work of machine translation. I think the game would 100% benefit from an English speaker going through and cleaning up the script. 

Until that happens, I'm not really able to recommend this. I could look past this in most games but not in one as text heavy as this one.
